identity.mission: Create a visceral, nostalgic, and hyper-pink Y2K experience for Anna. Break modern flat design rules. Embrace chaos, shine, and emotion.

visuals: Windows 95/2000 style UI elements with a pink twist
aesthetics.vibe: Mean Girls x The Matrix x Tamagotchi

typography.instructions: Use Orbitron for futuristic headers, Fredoka for bubbly/friendly body text, and VT323 for retro data/terminal elements. Import from Google Fonts.

layout_strategy.grid: Absolute/scattered positioning mixed with centered modals
layout_strategy.container_style: Retro OS Window (Pink Borders, Title Bars)

LandingPage.description: A high-energy entry point. User must 'charge' the heart to enter.
features: Clicking the heart spawns floating mini-hearts (Framer Motion)
Progress bar fills up with clicks
Background: Starfield or scrolling binary code in pink

CountdownCarousel.description: The core journey. Slides 10 down to 1.
structure: 10: Things I Love About You (List view)
6: Songs That Remind Me of You (Winamp playlist view)
CountdownCarousel.navigation: Previous/Next buttons styled like retro arrows or game controllers.

ProposalReveal.description: The climax. 'Anna, will you be my Valentine?'

RetroWindow.style: Pink border, gradient title bar with 'X' button, scanline content background.

assets.icons: Lucide React (Heart, Star, Music, MapPin, Trophy, Utensils)

textures.noise: CSS url('data:image/svg...') or similar noise generator

assets.sounds: Optional: Pop sounds on click (use HTML5 Audio if assets available, otherwise skip)

universal_guidelines: Do not use default Shadcn styles. Override everything with custom CSS/Tailwind.
Use 'cursor-wait' or custom crosshair cursors for that retro feel.
Add a 'Marquee' at the bottom scrolling 'HAPPY VALENTINES DAY ANNA <3'.
Ensure the 'No' button is practically unclickable in the proposal.
Use data-testid for all interactive elements.
instructions_to_main_agent: Create the 'RetroWindow' component first as it wraps everything.
Build the 10 slides for CountdownCarousel with unique layouts for each.
Use inline CSS or Tailwind arbitrary values for the specific gradients and shadows.
Ensure responsive design (mobile friendly) - stack the retro windows vertically on mobile.
